summary: most of those released were women and children, a peshmerga commander says . isis previously released scores of other yazidis .
aspect: ISIS released over 200 Yazidis, a minority group whose members were killed, captured, and displaced last summer, with most being women and children. The release's motive is unclear, as Arab tribal leaders helped coordinate it. ISIS has previously released scores of other Yazidis since last year's attacks.
explain: The Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS) released over 200 Yazidis, a persecuted religious minority, with most being women and children. The motive of the release is unclear, as it was facilitated by Arab tribal leaders. Since last year's attacks, ISIS has also previously released other Yazidis.
